text: Any changes/news on this? <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1712690194089779> I have basically the same need (load global styles in storybook). Following the `./storybook/preview-head.html` pattern would be great.

<@U04DVL5T2TE> sorry for tagging you here, but since this thread is 9months old, I wanted to know what your thoughts are :grimacing:
<@U02MW4FGFH9> how did you solve the issue in your project?
FYI, <@U04DVL5T2TE> is no longer working at HubSpot (:face_holding_back_tears:). And I’m pretty sure that there are haven’t been too many additions to storybook configurability in a while.
<@UCY83QS6Q> thanks for the reply! do you know if what I'm trying to achieve is possible in any way? (providing global styles, not necessarily tailwind, for storybook components)

has anyone been able to get the prettier tailwind plugin working? (I'd like to automatically sort classes in the way). I'm getting this error:
```["ERROR" - 12:59:25 PM] Error formatting document.
["ERROR" - 12:59:25 PM] Cannot use 'import.meta' outside a module
/Users/xxx.xxx/code/xxx-xxx/src-react/theme-assets-project/app/tailwind.config.js:2
const componentsDir = _url.fileURLToPath.call(void 0, new URL("./components", import.meta.url));```
Anyone else getting Cloudflare's infinite loop of _"Verifying you are human. This may take a few seconds."_ on their local env (e.g. `<http://XXXXXX.hs-sites.com.hslocal.net:3000/>` ??
